body_html:
It's not true that the overhead is always very low - this is only the case if the rename occurs within a single file system. If e.g. /tmp is mounted as a local fs, and the checkpoint dir is on an NFS drive (it's a very common setup), then you actually have to copy all the data. I don't think it's a good idea to include this by default. If you need this in your application, and if it's cheap in your case, then you're free to use tempfile for saving, and then add the code that renames it in your script.

Thanks for the PR, but in the future please reach out to us via issues, so you don't spend time integrating things into the library unnecessarily 😕

body:
It's not true that the overhead is always very low - this is only the case if the rename occurs within a single file system. If e.g. `/tmp` is mounted as a local fs, and the checkpoint dir is on an NFS drive (it's a very common setup), then you actually have to copy all the data. I don't think it's a good idea to include this by default. If you need this in your application, and if it's cheap in your case, then you're free to use `tempfile` for saving, and then add the code that renames it in your script.

Thanks for the PR, but in the future please reach out to us via issues, so you don't spend time integrating things into the library unnecessarily 😕
